semantic_identifier: 16: feat: Backend conflict detection for cross-segment positioning recommendations

sections.text:
## Description

This PR adds backend conflict detection for positioning recommendations generated across multiple segments and persists the results for UI surfacing.

Changes:
- Introduces a canonical taxonomy for positioning recommendation categories/fields (e.g., valueProps, differentiators, objectionResponses) and normalizes generated output into this schema prior to persistence.
- Implements a rule-based contradiction engine that runs at generation time:
  - flags direct opposites (via a small, maintainable antonym/opposition map and explicit polarity rules)
  - flags mutually exclusive differentiators/claims (e.g., “lowest cost” vs “premium priced”) based on category-specific incompatibility rules
  - compares statements across segments within the same generation job and records conflicts when two segments produce contradictory statements for the same canonical field.
- Persists conflict metadata alongside the generation result, including:
  - segment identifiers involved
  - canonical field/category
  - the two conflicting statements (and their source recommendation ids, when available)
  - conflict type/reason (rule id) for deterministic UI messaging.
- Adds tests for normalization and contradiction rules, plus end-to-end coverage ensuring conflicts are created and stored during generation.

Notes for reviewers/users:
- Conflict detection is intentionally simple and deterministic (no ML); rules are centralized so we can iterate safely without changing UI contracts.
- Existing generations are unaffected; conflict metadata is only produced for new/updated runs that go through the updated generation pipeline.

## How Has This Been Tested?
